intro: Kefersteinia elegans, commonly known as the elegant kefersteinia, is a unique member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its delicate, fern-like foliage. It produces small, white flowers arranged in umbels, which bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant is native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia and thrives in cool, moist environments. Its leaves are finely divided and have a slight aromatic scent, typical of many members of its family. Kefersteinia elegans is often cultivated in gardens for its ornamental value and its ability to thrive in shaded, well-drained soils.
